alert.note: Alert for Inland Worcester; Somerset; Wicomico (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 6:42PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Somerset, southeastern Wicomico and Worcester Counties through 730 PM EDT... At 641 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Gumboro to near Newark to near Pocomoke City. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Heavy rain and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. Frequent cloud to ground lightning strikes. Locations impacted include... Pocomoke City, Princess Anne, University Of Maryland Eastern Shore, Berlin, Snow Hill, Westover, Ocean Pines, Parsonsburg, West Pocomoke, Newark, Pittsville, Willards, Bishop, Cokesbury, Goodwill, Kingston, Longridge, Cedartown, Powellville and Mount Wesley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for southeastern Maryland...and portions of southeastern Virginia.
